Key Match Events: Emmanuel Clase rebounded by retiring Aaron Judge on a flyout, striking out Giancarlo Stanton with a 100.6 mph fastball, and retiring Oswaldo Cabrera on a groundout after Jazz Chisholm Jr.'s two-out single.
Hunter Gaddis served up a go-ahead three-run homer to Juan Soto in the 10th inning.
Brayan Rocchio's error on a potential inning-ending double-play ball allowed everyone to be safe, leading to Juan Soto's decisive home run.
Pre-Game Insights: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt expressed his unwavering support for Emmanuel Clase before the game, stating, 'Emmanuel will be right back out there in the ninth tonight, because he's our guy.'
Post-Match Reflections: Stephen Vogt reflected on Clase's performance, stating, 'He responded the way I thought he would. This is the best closer on the planet. I’ll stand by that.'
Vogt commented on the decision not to let Clase pitch the 10th inning due to his high pitch count over the last three days.
Brayan Rocchio reflected on his error, stating, 'In that moment, it’s more important to get two outs rather than one. … Unfortunately, I was not able to catch the ball.'
Vogt praised the bullpen's overall performance, stating, 'If it wasn’t for that group of guys in the bullpen, we wouldn’t have gotten this far into this season. They deserve a ton of credit.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cleveland's bullpen ended the regular season with the fourth-best bullpen ERA (2.57) of any team since 1995.
Cleveland's bullpen combined for 53 2/3 innings with a 3.52 ERA in the postseason, while starting pitchers combined for 33 2/3 innings and a 3.82 ERA.
